messages.title: Three Things to Remember
messages.content: Remember to vote and tell your friends. Join your fast growing ranks of supporters. Labour have left the economy in a mess.

messages.title: A Second ExtraCare Village for Milton Keynes
messages.content: Following the success of the Lovat Fields ExtraCare village at Willen Park, the Liberal Democrat Council has taken the lead in opening a second village in Bletchley.

messages.title: True Grit - but NOT in South Tattenhoe
messages.content: Residents of Nash Croft, Tattenhoe faced difficulty during severe winter conditions because the area wasn't a priority for grit.

messages.title: A New Bus Stop for Kingsmead
messages.content: Kingsmead residents now have a bus stop close to Kingsmead due to actions by the Liberal Democrat Focus Team.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Implement a 'green jobs' programme to create or preserve jobs, insulating homes, schools and hospitals and expanding the rail network by building the Milton Keynes Council civic offices.
A cut in income tax of up to £700 a year for those on lower incomes.
Keeping people in their homes, so they don't face unfair re-possession.

Action to force the banks owned by the tax payer to lend to small businesses so that they don't go under, a huge investment in skills education - unlike the early 1990s, when the recession ended and millions were left on the employment scrap heap.
Improving local transport options, such as the initiative to install a new bus stop to provide better services for Kingsmead residents.
Ensuring that all areas, including South Tattenhoe, receive necessary resources like grit during severe winter conditions.

mentions.candidate: Burke Jones has been actively involved in various community initiatives including securing a second ExtraCare village, addressing a local bus service issue in Kingsmead, and advocating for better winter preparedness in South Tattenhoe.
mentions.partyLeader: Vince Cable and his Treasury Team have made strategic decisions that are influencing the party's policies.

issues.economy: Labour have left the economy in a mess. A huge 'green jobs' programme to create or preserve jobs.
issues.socialWelfare: A cut in income tax of up to £700 a year for those on lower incomes.

housing.content: Following the success of the Lovat Fields ExtraCare village at Willen Park, the Liberal Democrat Council has taken the lead in opening a second village in Bletchley, ensuring that also Bletchley can benefit from the popular model of an ExtraCare Village.

politicalExperience.duration: In office since being elected in 2002
politicalExperience.achievements: Securing the opening of the second ExtraCare village in Bletchley.

images.caption: Cllr Stuart Burke with members of the Liberal Democrat Focus Team
Liberal Democrat Parliamentary Candidate, Peter, works alongside Vince Cable and the Treasury Team

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet mentions initiatives and improvements pushed by the Liberal Democrats in the local area, focusing on service delivery and highlighting past successes and future commitments.
